summary: Email exchange between an Assistant United States Attorney and another individual regarding coordination to deliver bank subpoena returns related to the Epstein case to a case agent at the SDNY office. The email references FirstBank Puerto Rico as the source of the returns.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the initial email requesting assistance with delivering bank subpoena returns for the Epstein case to a case agent.

events.title: Coordination for Bank Subpoena Returns Delivery
events.description: Email exchange to coordinate delivery of recent bank subpoena returns from FirstBank Puerto Rico to the Epstein case agent at the SDNY office.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email from June 1, 2020, regarding the Epstein case investigation.
It involves coordination to deliver bank subpoena returns from FirstBank Puerto Rico to a case agent.
The returns were intended to be left at the SDNY office at One Saint Andrew's Plaza in New York.
The email indicates ongoing financial investigation into Epstein's affairs as of mid-2020.
The correspondence shows procedural coordination between legal personnel handling the case.
